item.title: LimeWire Sued for $7.5 Trillion, Judge Denies
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

IlikeArrays:

What was so illegal about limewire? They created a program that people can share pictures/videos/music. Its the individuals fault for letting other people download stuff for free. If I remember correctly limewire never gave out free stuff? Just gave a program that allowed for easy transfers.

The reason a Dutch company who offered something remotely similar was that they enabled people to share stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: LimeWire Sued for $7.5 Trillion, Judge Denies
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

How exactly do they expect limewire to acquire said money?..

You would be daft to believe that Limewire didn’t profit even a little from the run that they were on. From website advertising, selling their clients (aka limewire pro), etc. Obviously it doesn’t approach the staggering amounts that the music industry is seeking but I’m sure the judge will see fit to make them pay reparations close to what they profited before they shutdown.

Read full topic
item.source: LimeWire Sued for $7.5 Trillion, Judge Denies

item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:10, topic:388076”]So they decided to sue LimeWire but ignored the multiple P2P networks out there? Real smart, if you ask me.
Also what was the reason for suing them even though they’ve been up for a while?[/quote]To my knowledge they, along with Napster, started the big illegal file download boom.

item.title: LimeWire Sued for $7.5 Trillion, Judge Denies
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:6, topic:388076”][quote author=zachera link=topic=483892.msg3546484#msg3546484 date=1301217169]
I’m assuming they did statistical research and added the total amount of downloads over the last N years of torrenting * rand(0.99,1.29) and ended up with this staggering amount. Funny.
[/quote]

[quote]In essence, take the 50 million LimeWire users and multiply that number with the maximum statutory damage award of $150,000[/quote][/quote]Ah.
